module.name: InterfaceBase
module.short: Provides an platform independent widgetset and helper functions.

element.name: TLCLWndMethod
element.short: The type of all LCL message handlers.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcCanDrawOutsideOnPaint
element.short: Supports drawing outside OnPaint event of an control.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcNeedMininimizeAppWithMainForm
element.short: When main form is minimized, then minimize also app.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcApplicationTitle
element.short: Can change application title at runtime.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcApplicationWindow
element.short: Application has a special root window.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcDragDockStartOnTitleClick
element.short: Can drag-dock forms from the title bar.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcAntialiasingEnabledByDefault
element.short: Is amDontCare = amOn for the widgetset.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcReceivesLMClearCutCopyPasteReliably
element.short: In Carbon we do not receive LM_CLEAR, CUT, COPY, PASTE etc. reliably, and this affects DB controls.

element.name: TDialogButton.ModalResult
element.short: The modal result, returned when the button is clicked.

element.name: TDialogButtons.FindButton
element.short: Find the button associated with (one of) the given modal result.

element.name: TDialogButtons.FindButton.Order
element.short: List of modal results to find.

element.name: TDialogButtons.DefaultButton
element.short: The Default button for this dialog kind.

element.name: TDialogButtons.CancelButton
element.short: The Cancel button for this dialog kind.

element.name: TDialogButtons.Items
element.short: Indexed access to the button descriptions.

element.name: TWSTimerProc
element.short: Type of a timer callback procedure

element.name: TWidgetSet
element.short: Application helper class (platform and drawing interface).

descr.p: The declaration contains a number of specific methods for interfacing with the operating system.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppInit
element.short: Initializes the application on the platform, returns Screen information.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppWaitMessage
element.short: Waits for arrival of a message.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppMinimize
element.short: Minimizes the whole application to the taskbar.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRestore
element.short: Restore application previously minimized to the taskbar.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppBringToFront
element.short: Brings the entire application on top of all other non-topmost programs.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetIcon
element.short: Set the icon of the taskbar button.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetVisible
element.short: Change the visibility of the application window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRemoveStayOnTopFlags
element.short: Resets all StayOnTop windows to NoTopmost.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRestoreStayOnTopFlags
element.short: Sets all windows in the StayOnTop list to TopMost.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetMainFormOnTaskBar
element.short: Make the MainForm (in)visible in the TaskBar (exchange with application window).

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetMainFormOnTaskBar.DoSet
element.short: The visibility of the MainForm in the TaskBar.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetLCLCapability
element.short: Checks the widgetset for available capabilities.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InitStockFont
element.short: Initializes a font object to an (predefined) stock font.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateTimer
element.short: Creates an timer with the given callback method.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateTimer.Result
element.short: The timer ID, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppHandle
element.short: Handle to which application messages can be sent[?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.Arc
element.short: Use Arc to draw an elliptically curved line with the current Pen.

descr.p: The arc is (part of) an ellipse in a bounding rectangle.

The angles angle1 and angle2 are 1/16th of a degree. For example, a full circle equals 5760 (16*360). Positive values of Angle and AngleLength mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean clockwise direction. Zero degrees is at the 3'o clock position.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AngleChord
element.short: Use AngleChord to draw a filled Chord shape on a canvas.

descr.p: The chord is outlined with the current pen, and filled with the current brush.

The angles angle1 and angle2 are 1/16th of a degree. For example, a full circle equals 5760 16*360). Positive values of Angle and AngleLength mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean clockwise direction. Zero degrees is at the 3'o clock position.
This function is for use in WM_PAINT handlers only. Not all platforms allow for painting outside WM_PAINT messages.
BeginPaint prepares the specified window for painting and fills a PAINTSTRUCT structure with information about the painting.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BeginPaint.Result
element.short: A Device Context for the window, Nil on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt
element.short: Copies part of an source DC into an destination DC, using the specified raster operation.

descr.p: This routine implements the equivalent Windows GDI API of the same name in all platforms supported by Lazarus.

It copies a section of a Canvas to another one, without any stretching. It allows to select the kind of operation which should be performed to draw the pixels into the destination in the parameter ROP. Allowed operations go from simply copying the pixels without change to inverting them and also to executing logical operations involving the source pixels and the previously existing pixels in the destination Canvas.
For normal usage one should only use SRCOPY in the ROP parameter, other operations may not be supported by all widgetsets.
There exist 16 raster operations, according to the possible combinations of two (boolean) values. Excluding the NOP case, that doesn't modify the target area, the possible values for ROP are:

ul.li: BLACKNESS - Fills the destination rectangle with black
DSTINVERT - Inverts the colors of the destination area
SRCPAINT - Combines the colors of the source and the destination using the operator OR on each pixel
WHITENESS - Fills the destination rectangle with white

descr.p: These flags can be added to above ROPs:

ul.li: CAPTUREBLT - Includes windows which are on top of the specified Canvas. This option is not recommended and is very hard to implement in all supported platforms.
NOMIRRORBITMAP - Prevents the bitmap from being mirrored. (The coordinates are sorted before painting?)

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.X
element.short: The origin in the destination DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.Y
element.short: The origin in the destination DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.XSrc
element.short: The origin in the source DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.YSrc
element.short: The origin in the source DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CallNextHookEx
element.short: Calls the next procedure in the hook chain.
element.descr: Useless without SetWindowsHookEx(). [How to install an system Hook?] [Which hook types exist?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.CallWindowProc
element.short: Calls another Window procedure, to handle a message.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ClientToScreen
element.short: Converts (relative) Client coordinates into absolute Screen coordinates.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ClientToScreen.Handle
element.short: The window with the client area.

descr.p: The Destination must already be initialized. The Return value is the Destination's Region type, or ERROR (0).
fnCombineMode can be one of:

ul.li: RGN_AND : Gets a region of all points which are in both source regions.
RGN_COPY : Gets an exact copy of the first source region.
RGN_DIFF : Gets a region of all points which are in the first source region but not in the second.(Src1 - Src2)
RGN_OR : Gets a region of all points which are in either the first source region or in the second.(Src1 + Src2)
RGN_XOR : Gets all points which are in either the first Source Region or in the second, but not in both.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.Result
element.short: The Destination's Region type, or ERROR (0).

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.Dest
element.short: The Handle of the destination region. This region must already exist!

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.Src1
element.short: The handle of a region to combine.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.Src2
element.short: The handle of a region to combine.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateBitmap
element.short: Creates a bitmap with the specified width, height, and color format (color planes and bits per pixel).

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateBitmap.BitCount
element.short: The number of color bits per pixel and plane.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateBitmap.BitmapBits
element.short: Pointer to array containing color data.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateBrushIndirect
element.short: Creates a logical brush that has the specified style, color, and pattern.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateBrushIndirect.Result
element.short: The brush Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateCaret
element.short: Creates a new shape for the system caret and assigns ownership of the caret to the specified window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateCaret.Handle
element.short: The window that owns the caret.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateCaret.Bitmap
element.short: Bitmap Handle, or zero for a solid (black) caret, 1 for a grey caret.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateCompatibleBitmap
element.short: Creates a bitmap that is compatible with the given DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateCompatibleBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateCompatibleBitmap.DC
element.short: The Device Context for the bitmap.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateCompatibleDC
element.short: Creates an memory Device Context, compatible with the device of the given DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateCompatibleDC.Result
element.short: The memory DC, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBitmap
element.short: Creates a Device Dependent Bitmap (DDB) from a Device Independent Bitmap (DIB).

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBitmap.InitBits
element.short: An array containing the bitmap pixels.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBitmap.InitInfo
element.short: CBM_INIT when InitBits contains valid data, else zero.[?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBSection
element.short: Creates a bitmap into which the application can write.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBSection.Result
element.short: The bitmap Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBSection.BitmapInfo
element.short: Contains all information about the bitmap, except the pixels.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBSection.Usage
element.short: The type of the bitmap colors, e.g. DIB_RGB_COLORS.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBSection.SectionHandle
element.short: Zero or the Handle of a file-mapping object, from which the bitmap is initialized (needs CreateFileMapping).

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateDIBSection.Offset
element.short: The offset to the bitmap bits in the file-mapping object.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateEllipticRgn
element.short: Creates an elliptic region, bounded by the given rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateEllipticRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateFontIndirect
element.short: Creates an logical font, selectable into any DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateFontIndirect.Result
element.short: The font handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateFontIndirectEx
element.short: Creates an logical font, selectable into any DC. Allows for an long fontname.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateFontIndirectEx.Result
element.short: The font handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateFontIndirectEx.LongFontName
element.short: The font name, can be longer than 32 characters.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePalette
element.short: Creates a logical palette, selectable into any DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePalette.Result
element.short: The palette Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePatternBrush
element.short: Creates a logical brush, selectable into any DC.

descr.p: The bitmap pattern is repeated for areas of larger width or height, it should allow for smooth transitions.
Monochrome bitmaps obtain the actual text (0) or background (1) color of the DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePatternBrush.Result
element.short: The brush handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePatternBrush.ABitmap
element.short: The bitmap to use for the brush.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePenIndirect
element.short: Creates an logical Pen, selectable into any DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePenIndirect.Result
element.short: The pen Handle, zero on failure.

descr.p: The Points parameter is an array of points that give the vertices of the polygon. The connections between two points can cross others.

FillMode determines what points are going to be included in the region. When FillMode=Winding points are selected by using the Winding fill algorithm. When FillMode=ALTERNATE points are selected by using using the even-odd (alternative) fill algorithm.
The last point is connected to the first point, to close the region.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePolygonRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePolygonRgn.NumPts
element.short: The number of points in Points.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateRectRgn.Result
element.short: The region handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateRoundRectRgn
element.short: Creates a rectangular region with rounded corners.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateRoundRectRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateRoundRectRgn.nWidthEllipse
element.short: The extent of the ellipse, used for the rounded corners.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateRoundRectRgn.nHeightEllipse
element.short: The extent of the ellipse, used for the rounded corners.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DeleteCriticalSection
element.errors: Results are unpredictable when the section is owned, i.e. has been entered but not yet left.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DeleteDC
element.short: Deletes an Device Context, created by CreateDC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DeleteObject
element.short: Deletes a graphic object, freeing all system resources associated with the object.
element.errors: The function fails when the Handle is selected into an DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DestroyCaret
element.short: Destroys the caret but doesn't free the bitmap.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DestroyCaret.Handle
element.short: Handle of the window with the caret.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DPtoLP
element.short: Converts an array of Device Points (coordinates) into Logical Points.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DPtoLP.DC
element.short: The device context, containing the coordinate mapping information.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DPtoLP.Count
element.short: The number of points to convert.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFrameControl
element.short: Draws a window frame control, of the specified type and style.

descr.p: A window frame includes these components (uType):
Window managers do not normally allow the user to paint the components of an window frame, do not even supply an DC for that purpose.
The available features depend on the window manager of the actual platform, and the used widgetset.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFrameControl.uState
element.short: The control state, e.g. DFCS_CAPTIONCLOSE (close button).

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFocusRect
element.short: Shows or hides a floating rectangle.

descr.p: This function is intended to temporarily outline part of an canvas, e.g. a rectangular selection following mouse moves (rubber box, DockRect).

A second call of the function, with the same parameters, removes the rectangle again (XOR painting). Due to this behaviour the frame should be removed before it might be overwritten by any other painting operation.
descr.remark: Not all platforms allow for painting outside WM_PAINT events.
Child windows may be excluded (clipped), i.e. the rectangle is not necessarily fully shown.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawEdge
element.short: Draws one or more edges of a rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawEdge.edge
element.short: A combination of edge styles (inner/outer, raised/sunken)

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawEdge.grfFlags
element.short: Indicates e.g. the edges to paint (BF_LEFT).

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawText
element.short: Draws formatted text within a rectangle.

descr.p: Several formatting options are available (DT_WORDBREAK...).
DT_CALCRECT suppresses all painting, instead the extent of the formatted text is returned in the Rect parameter.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawText.Result
element.short: The height of the drawn text, from Rect.Top to the bottom of the text. Zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawText.Count
element.short: The number of (Wide)Chars in the text.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnableScrollBar
element.short: Enables or disables the arrows of a scrollbar control, or of the scrollbars of a window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnableWindow
element.short: Enables or disables mouse and keyboard input to the specified window or control.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnableWindow.Result
element.short: True when the window was disabled before.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EndPaint
element.short: Ends painting a window, started with BeginPaint.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnterCriticalSection
element.descr: The call returns only when the calling thread has obtained ownership of the critical section. See TryEnterCriticalSection for testing the ownership of the critical section.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumDisplayMonitors
element.short: Invokes a callback function for every available display monitor.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumDisplayMonitors.dwData
element.short: Data passed to the callback function[?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumFontFamilies
element.short: Invokes a callback function for every font available on a specified device.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumFontFamilies.Result
element.short: The last value returned by the callback function.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumFontFamilies.Family
element.short: The font family name, empty for all families.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumFontFamilies.LParam
element.short: Data passed to the callback function.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumFontFamiliesEx
element.short: Invokes a callback function for every available font that matches certain criteria.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumFontFamiliesEx.Result
element.short: The last value returned by the callback function.

element.name: TWidgetSet.EnumFontFamiliesEx.Lparam
element.short: Data passed to the callback function.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Ellipse
element.short: Draws a filled circle or ellipse, bounded by a rectangle.
element.descr: The ellipse is outlined with the current pen, and filled with the current brush.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExcludeClipRect
element.short: Excludes a rectangle from the clipping region, i.e. prevents painting within the rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExcludeClipRect.Result
element.short: The type of the new clipping region, Error (0) on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtCreatePen
element.short: Creates an logical pen, selectable into any DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtCreatePen.Result
element.short: The pen handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtCreatePen.dwStyleCount
element.short: The number of sections of an dashed pen.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtCreatePen.lpStyle
element.short: Array of the section lengths of an dashed pen.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtTextOut
element.short: Draws an string without formatting (single line).

descr.p: The string is drawn with the current font and colors.
The following Options are supported:

ul.li: ETO_CLIPPED - the text is clipped to the given rectangle.
ETO_OPAQUE - the rectangle is filled with the background color.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtTextOut.X
element.short: The reference point, used to position the string.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtTextOut.Y
element.short: The reference point, used to position the string.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtTextOut.Count
element.short: The number of (Wide)Chars in the string.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtTextOut.Dx
element.short: Pointer to an array of intercharacter spacing values, can be Nil.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtSelectClipRGN
element.short: Combines the passed Region with the current clipping region.

descr.p: The Mode can be one of:

ul.li: RGN_AND - all points which are in both regions.
RGN_COPY - an exact copy of the source region, same as SelectClipRGN.
RGN_DIFF - all points which are in the Clipping Region but but not in the Source. (Clip - RGN)
RGN_OR - all points which are in either the Clip Region or in the Source. (Clip + RGN)
RGN_XOR - all points which are in either the Clip Region or in the Source, but not in both.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtSelectClipRGN.Result
element.short: The type of the resulting clipping region.

element.name: TWidgetSet.FillRect
element.short: Fills a rectangle using the specified brush.

element.name: TWidgetSet.FillRgn
element.short: Fills a region using the specified brush.

element.name: TWidgetSet.FloodFill
element.short: Fills an area of the display surface with the current brush.

descr.p: FillStyle specifies the area:

ul.li: When FillStyle is fsBorder, the area is bounded by a certain Color, the boundary must not have gaps in it.
When FillStyle is fsSurface, the area has the specified Color, and all adjacent pixels of this color are replaced.

descr.p: Filling starts at a given point, which resides somewhere inside the area.

element.name: TWidgetSet.FloodFill.Color
element.short: The area or boundary color, depending on FillStyle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.FloodFill.Brush
element.short: The brush used to fill the area.

element.name: TWidgetSet.FrameRect
element.short: Draws a border around a rectangle.
element.descr: The boundary is one logical unit wide, painted using the given brush.

element.name: TWidgetSet.FrameRect.hBr
element.short: The brush for drawing the border.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetActiveWindow
element.short: Returns the Handle of the active window of the calling thread.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetActiveWindow.Result
element.short: The window handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetBitmapBits
element.short: Fills an buffer with the bitmap bits.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetBitmapBits.Result
element.short: The number of bytes copied, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetBitmapBits.Count
element.short: The byte size of the buffer.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetBkColor
element.short: Returns the background color of an device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetBkColor.Result
element.short: The background color, CLR_INVALID on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCapture
element.short: Returns the window that captures mouse messages.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCapture.Result
element.short: The window handle, zero if no window of the thread captures mouse messages.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCaretPos
element.short: Returns the caret position, in client coordinates.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetClientRect
element.short: Returns the client rectangle of a window.

descr.p: The client rectangle is the size of the inner area of a control, where e.g. the child controls are visible. Left and Top are always 0.
A child control with Align=alClient will completely fill the clientrect.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetClipBox
element.short: Returns the smallest rectangle which includes the entire clipping region of an device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetClipRGN
element.short: Returns the clipping region of an device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetClipRGN.RGN
element.short: The handle of the clipping region.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCurrentObject
element.short: Returns an currently selected object in an device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCurrentObject.Result
element.short: The object handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCurrentObject.uObjectType
element.short: The type of the selected object, e.g. OBJ_BRUSH.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCursorPos
element.short: Gets the mouse cursor position, in screen coordinates.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCharABCWidths
element.short: Returns the ABC widths of an range of character codes.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetCharABCWidths.ABCStructs
element.short: Array of ABC records, receiving the information.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetDC
element.short: Returns the handle of an Device Context (DC) for the client area of a window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetDC.Result
element.short: The DC handle, zero on failure.

descr.p: The following informations can be retrieved:

ul.li: BITSPIXEL - Number of bits per pixel
LOGPIXELSX - The number of pixels per logical inch, in X (horizontal) direction.
LOGPIXELSY - The number of pixels per logical inch, in Y (vertical) direction.
SIZEPALETTE - Number of entries in the color palette
NUMRESERVED - Number of reserved entries in the color palette

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetDIBits
element.short: Fills an buffer with bitmap color bits.

descr.p: The bitmap must be a compatible (device dependent) bitmap, for the given device context. It should not be selected into any DC.
The color bits are copied into the Bits array in Device Independent Bitmap (DIB) format.
When Bits is Nil, the BitInfo record receives the bitmap information, from which the required size of the Bits array can be determined.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetDIBits.Result
element.short: The number of returned scanlines, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetDIBits.NumScans
element.short: The number of scanlines to retrieve.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetDIBits.Bits
element.short: Pointer to the color bits array, or Nil to get the BitmapInfo.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetDoubleClickTime
element.short: Returns the double-click time, in milliseconds.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetFocus
element.short: Returns the handle of the window that has the focus in the current thread.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetFocus.Result
element.short: The window handle, zero if no window has the focus.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetFontLanguageInfo
element.short: Returns language information about the currently selected font.

descr.p: The following flags are supported:

ul.li: GCP_DBCS - the character set is double-byte (DBCS).

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetFontLanguageInfo.Result
element.short: Font flags, zero for Latin font alikes.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetForegroundWindow
element.short: Returns the window that the user is currently working with, session wide.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetForegroundWindow.Result
element.short: The window handle, zero when no such window exists.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetIconInfo
element.short: Returns information about an Icon or Cursor.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetKeyState
element.short: The status of a virtual key.

descr.p: The result reflects the message processing state, at the time of the last seen key message.
A key can be up, down or toggled.
The high order bit of the result is the up/down state, 1 for down.
The low order bit of the result is the toggled state, applicable to e.g. the caps-lock key. The bit is set if the key is toggled (active).

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetMapMode
element.short: Returns the mapping mode of an device context.

descr.p: The mapping mode specifies the correspondence between logical and physical units. Supported modes are:

ul.li: MM_ISOTROPIC - arbitrary mapping, same for X and Y axis

descr.p: Positive X is right, except for (an)isotropic mappings. Positive Y is up, except for (an)isotropic and MM_TEXT mappings.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetMapMode.Result
element.short: The mapping mode, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetMonitorInfo
element.short: Returns information about an display monitor.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetObject
element.short: Returns information about a graphics object.
element.descr: The returned information depends on the object type [to be found out how?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetObject.Result
element.short: The number of bytes written into the buffer.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetObject.Buf
element.short: Receives the information. Nil means to return the required buffer size.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetPaletteEntries
element.short: Retrieves an range of color entries from a logical palette.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetPaletteEntries.NumEntries
element.short: The number of entries to retrieve.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetPaletteEntries.PaletteEntries
element.short: Array of PALETTEENTRY records, receiving the information.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetParent
element.short: Returns the parent window of a window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetParent.Result
element.short: The parent window handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetProp
element.short: Retrieves an property value for a window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetRgnBox
element.short: Returns the bounding rectangle of a region, containing the entire region.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetROP2
element.short: The current Foreground Mixing Mode in an device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetScrollInfo
element.short: Returns all or selected information about a ScrollBar.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetScrollInfo.ScrollInfo
element.short: Recieves the values indicated in fMask.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetStockObject
element.short: Retrieves a handle to one of the predefined graphic objects.

descr.p: These are the predefined stock objects: [todo: fill in the details?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetSysColor
element.short: Retrieves the system color for standard display elements.

descr.p: These are the available display elements: [todo: fill in details?]
Since all returned values are valid colors, errors cannot be detected. GetSysColorBrush instead returns a zero handle on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetSysColorBrush
element.short: Retrieves a system brush for standard display elements.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetSysColorBrush.Result
element.short: The brush handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetSystemPaletteEntries
element.short: Retrieves an range of color entries from the system palette for a device.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetSystemPaletteEntries.Result
element.short: The number of entries copied, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetSystemPaletteEntries.PaletteEntries
element.short: Receives the color information. When Nil, the total number of palette entries is returned.

descr.p: All dimensions are measured in pixels.
These are available items: [todo: insert details?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextColor
element.short: The current text color in an device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentExPoint
element.short: Calculates the number of characters, that fit into some horizontal space.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentExPoint.Count
element.short: The number of logical characters in Str, -1 for automatic detection.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentExPoint.MaxWidth
element.short: The maximum display width, in logical units.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentExPoint.MaxCount
element.short: Receives the number of logical (UTF) characters that can be displayed. When Nil, MaxWidth is ignored.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentExPoint.PartialWidths
element.short: Receives the widths for every partial sequence of characters. Can be Nil.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentExPoint.Size
element.short: Receives the total width and height of the display area.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentPoint
element.short: Computes the display width and height of an string.
element.errors: May not work properly without Unicode support.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentPoint.Count
element.short: The number of bytes in Str, -1 for automatic detection.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentPoint.Size
element.short: Receives the total width and height of the required display area.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextExtentPoint32
element.short: Computes the display width and height of an string.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextMetrics
element.short: Retrieves the metrics for the currently selected font.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetTextMetrics.DC
element.short: The device context, where the font is selected.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetViewPortExtEx
element.short: Returns the size of the viewport of an device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetViewPortOrgEx
element.short: Returns the origin of the viewport of an device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetWindowExtEx
element.short: Returns the extent of a window, in logical units.

descr.p: The following attributes are defined:

ul.li: GWL_EXSTYLE - extended window style flags. See CreateWindowEx.
GWL_WNDPROC - the window procedure (address or handle). See CallWindowProc.
GWL_HINSTANCE - handle of the application instance.
GWL_HWNDPARENT - handle of the parent window.
GWL_ID - the identifier of the window.
GWL_USERDATA - user data associated with the window.

descr.p: The following attributes are also available when the window is a dialog box:

ul.li: DWL_DLGPROC - the dialog box procedure (address or handle).
DWL_MSGRESULT - the return value of a message processed in the dialog box procedure.

descr.p: GWL_USERDATA and DWL_USER are the base offsets of user added attributes. The second user attribute can be access with an additional offset of 4, and so on.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetWindowRect
element.short: Retrieves the bounding rectangle of a window, in screen coordinates.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetWindowSize
element.short: Returns the [client?] Width and Height of the window.
element.descr: Even from the implementation it's unclear what exactly is calculated[!?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetWindowOrgEx
element.short: Retrieves the window origin of an device context, in logical units.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GradientFill
element.short: Fills rectangle or triangle areas with gradient colors.

element.name: TWidgetSet.HideCaret
element.short: Removes the caret from the screen.
element.descr: Calls are cumulative, for every HideCaret a call to ShowCaret is required.

element.name: TWidgetSet.HideCaret.hWnd
element.short: The window handle, can be zero.

descr.p: Critical sections are thread synchronization elements, typically used to prevent concurrent access to a shared resource.
Only one thread can own a critical section at the same time, other requests (to enter the same critical section) are delayed until the owner has left the critical section.
The TCriticalSection type is platform specific, treat it like a Handle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IntersectClipRect
element.short: Shrinks the clipping region of an Device Context to a rectangular boundary, e.g. a text area.

descr.p: Use this method before painting into a rectangle in an DC, to clip everything outside the rectangle and outside the current clipping region of the DC.

The result can be one of the following constants:
Error NullRegion SimpleRegion ComplexRegion Region_Error

element.name: TWidgetSet.IntersectClipRect.Result
element.short: The region type, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InvalidateRect
element.short: Marks a display area for repaint.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InvalidateRect.ARect
element.short: The client coordinates of the area.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InvalidateRect.bErase
element.short: True forces a repaint of the background, before further painting.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InvalidateRgn
element.short: Marks a display area for repaint.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InvalidateRgn.Erase
element.short: True forces a repaint of the background, before further painting.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsDBCSLeadByte.Result
element.short: True when the character code is the first of a double-byte character sequence [of which codepage?]

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsIconic
element.short: True when the window is minimized.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsIconic.Result
element.short: True when the window is minimized.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsWindow
element.short: Checks whether a handle refers to a window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsWindow.Result
element.short: True when handle is a valid window handle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsWindowEnabled
element.short: Determines whether a window can receive mouse and keyboard input.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsWindowEnabled.Result
element.short: True when the window is enabled (and visible).

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsWindowVisible
element.short: The definite Visible state of a window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsWindowVisible.Result
element.short: True when the window and all its parents are visible.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsZoomed
element.short: True when the window is maximized.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsZoomed.Result
element.short: True when the window is maximized.

element.name: TWidgetSet.LeaveCriticalSection
element.short: Releases a critical section, for use by other threads.

element.name: TWidgetSet.LineTo
element.short: Draws a line from the current position up to, but not including, the specified point.
element.descr: The current position is set to the given endpoint.

element.name: TWidgetSet.LPtoDP
element.short: Converts logical coordinates into device coordinates.

element.name: TWidgetSet.LPtoDP.Points
element.short: Holds and receives the transformed coordinates.

element.name: TWidgetSet.LPtoDP.Count
element.short: The number of points in Points.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt
element.short: Copies part of an source DC into an destination DC, using the specified foreground and background raster operations.

descr.p: MaskBlt behaves like BitBlt when no mask bitmap is specified. It does a SRCOPY operation when also no Rop is specified. See BitBlt for general information about raster operations.

Rop contains both a foreground and a background raster operation (see MakeROP4). When a (monochrome) mask bitmap is present, its bits select either the foreground (1) or background (0) raster operation.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.X
element.short: The origin of the destination rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.Y
element.short: The origin of the destination rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.Width
element.short: The size of the destination rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.Height
element.short: The size of the destination rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.XSrc
element.short: The origin of the source rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.YSrc
element.short: The origin of the source rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.Mask
element.short: The monochrome mask bitmap handle, can be zero.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.XMask
element.short: The origin of the mask rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MaskBlt.YMask
element.short: The origin of the mask rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MessageBox
element.short: The MessageBox function displays an modal dialog, with the given text, caption, icon and buttons.

descr.p: uType is a combination of flags from the following lists.
The shown buttons are selected by one of:

ul.li: MB_CANCELTRYCONTINUE - Cancel, Try Again, Continue. Use this message box type instead of MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE.

descr.p: Add MB_HELP for an Help button. When the user clicks the Help button or presses F1, the owner window receives a WM_HELP message.
An icon can be added by one of:

ul.li: MB_ICONINFORMATION, MB_ICONASTERISK - letter i in a circle

descr.p:
The default button number, activated when the user presses Enter, can be indicated by one of:
MB_DEFBUTTON1 MB_DEFBUTTON2 MB_DEFBUTTON3 MB_DEFBUTTON4
Further Windows MessageBox specific options are not (yet) implemented on other platforms.

The function result corresponds to the pressed button:
IDABORT IDCANCEL IDCONTINUE IDIGNORE IDNO IDOK IDRETRY IDTRYAGAIN IDYES

element.name: TWidgetSet.MessageBox.Result
element.short: The pressed button, or zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MessageBox.hWnd
element.short: The handle of the window that owns the MessageBox.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MessageBox.lpText
element.short: The text displayed in the MessageBox.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MessageBox.uType
element.short: Style flags specifiying the shown buttons etc.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MonitorFromPoint
element.short: Finds an monitor from screen coordinates.

short.p: When no monitor applies, dwFlags determines the result:

element.name: TWidgetSet.MonitorFromPoint.dwFlags
element.short: How coordinates outside any monitor are handled, see MonitorFromPoint.Result.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MonitorFromRect
element.short: Finds the monitor covering most of a rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MonitorFromRect.dwFlags
element.short: How coordinates outside any monitor are handled, see MonitorFromPoint.Result.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MonitorFromWindow
element.short: Finds the monitor covering most of a window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MonitorFromWindow.dwFlags
element.short: How coordinates outside any monitor are handled, see MonitorFromPoint.Result.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MoveToEx
element.short: Moves the current position to the specified point.

element.name: TWidgetSet.MoveToEx.OldPoint
element.short: Receives the old position, can be Nil if not required.

element.name: TWidgetSet.OffsetRgn.Result
element.short: The new region kind, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PeekMessage
element.short: Checks the thread's message queue for a message.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PeekMessage.Handle
element.short: The target window handle of the message. Zero for any window, INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE for thread messages.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PeekMessage.wMsgFilterMin
element.short: The lowest message ID to retrieve.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PeekMessage.wMsgFilterMax
element.short: The highest message ID to retrieve, zero for all messages.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PeekMessage.wRemoveMsg
element.short: PM_REMOVE will remove the message from the queue.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Pie
element.short: Draws a filled pie-shaped wedge, from an ellipse and two radials.

descr.p: The ellipse is bounded by a rectangle x1..y2.
Each radial is defined by the center of the rectangle an point, which must not necessarily reside on the ellipse.
The bounding arc goes counter-clockwise from the Start to the End radial.
The pie is outlined with the current pen and filled with the current brush.
Use Polybezier to draw cubic Bzier curves.
The first curve is drawn from the first point to the fourth point with the second and third points being the control points.
If the Continuous flag is TRUE then each subsequent curve requires three more points, using the end-point of the previous Curve as its starting point.
If the Continous flag is set to FALSE, then each subsequent Curve requires 4 additional points, which are used exactly as in the first curve.
Any additonal points which do not add up to a full bezier (4 for Continuous, 3 otherwise) are ignored. There must be at least 4 points for an drawing to occur.
If the Filled Flag is TRUE then the resulting Poly-Bzier will be drawn as a Polygon.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier.NumPts
element.short: The number of points in Points.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier.Continuous
element.short: True uses the end-point as the starting point of the next segment.

descr.p: Use Polygon to draw a closed, many-sided shape on the canvas, outlined with the current Pen and filled with the current Brush.
The Points parameter is an array of the vertices of the polygon.

Winding determines how the polygon is filled. When Winding is True, Polygon fills the shape using the Winding fill algorithm. When Winding is False, Polygon uses the even-odd (alternative) fill algorithm.
The first point is always connected to the last point.
To draw an unfilled polygon use the Polyline method, specifying the first point a second time at the end.
Use Polyline to connect a set of points on the canvas.
The Points parameter is an array of points to be connected.
If you specify only two points, Polyline draws a single line.

Calling the MoveTo function with the value of the first point, and then repeatedly calling LineTo with all subsequent points will draw the same image on the canvas. However, unlike LineTo, Polyline does not change the value of PenPos.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PostMessage
element.short: Sends a message to a window, without waiting for the message result.

descr.remark: This section was copied from LCLIntf, and may not apply to all platforms.
descr.p: This method is a thread-safe solution to send messages to windows. Those messages will be handled in the message loop of the application and therefore can be sent from any thread. They are not immediate, but they will awake the main thread if it is waiting for messages.
These messages can be handled by procedures with the keyword message in the class of a form for example. One would then use the handle of this form as the Handle parameter of this routine.
Custom messages should always have an identification number (represented by the parameter Msg) larger then the constant LM_USER.
The two parameters WParam and LParam will be passed along to the window together with the Msg identification number.

The difference between SendMessage and PostMessage is the way that they return control to the calling thread. With SendMessage control is not returned until the window that the message was sent to has completed processing the sent message, however with PostMessage control is returned immediately.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PtInRegion
element.short: Tests whether a point lies in a region.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PtInRegion.Result
element.short: True when the point lies in the region.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RealizePalette
element.short: Maps palette entries from the current logical palette to the system palette.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Rectangle
element.p: The rectangle is outlined with the current Pen, and filled with the current Brush.
The bottom and right edges are not part of the rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RectVisible
element.short: Checks whether the clipping region contains (part of) a rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RectVisible.Result
element.short: True when (part of) the rectangle is visible.

descr.p: All invalidated parts of a window, which deserve an update, are collected in the update region. When this region is not empty, WM_ERASEBKGND, WM_PAINT and WM_NCPAINT messages are sent to the window, as soon as the application is (almost) idle. RedrawWindow can be used to force an immediate redraw instead.
WM_ERASEBKGND is optional, erases the background before painting. WM_NCPAINT paints the non-client areas (borders, caption...), without assistance by user code.
When neither lprcUpdate nor hrgnUpdate are specified, the whole client area [only?] of the window is affected. Otherwise the region takes precedence over the rectangle.
Flags specify how the window is invalidated or validated, and when repainting occurs. To invalidate specify RDW_INVALIDATE, and optionally one of:

ul.li: RDW_ERASE - forces a WM_ERASEBKGND message before painting.
RDW_FRAME - also redraws the window frame, as covered by the update region.
RDW_INTERNALPAINT - force WM_PAINT even if the update region is empty.

descr.p: To validate specify RDW_VALIDATE, and optionally one of:

ul.li: RDW_NOERASE - suppress all pending WM_ERASEBKGND messages.
RDW_NOFRAME - suppress all pending WM_NCPAINT messages.
RDW_NOINTERNALPAINT - suppress all pending internal WM_PAINT messages.

descr.p: These flags specify when repainting will occur:

ul.li: RDW_ERASENOW - send WM_ERASEBKGND messages before returning.
RDW_UPDATENOW - send WM_PAINT messages before returning.

descr.p: The handling of child windows normally depends on the WS_CLIPCHILDREN window style flag. Clipped child windows are not normally affected by RedrawWindow. These flags override:

element.name: TWidgetSet.RedrawWindow.lprcUpdate
element.short: The rectangle to redraw, ignored when a region is given.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RedrawWindow.hrgnUpdate
element.short: The region to redraw, can be zero.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ReleaseCapture
element.short: Restores normal mouse input processing, after SetCapture.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ReleaseDC
element.short: Releases an Device Context obtained by GetDC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ReleaseDC.hWnd
element.short: The handle of the window, whose DC is released.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RemoveProp
element.short: Removes a named property from a window.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RemoveProp.Result
element.short: The handle of the removed data, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RemoveProp.Str
element.short: The name of the property to remove.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RestoreDC
element.short: Restores an Device Context (DC) to an previously saved state.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RestoreDC.SavedDC
element.short: The index returned by SaveDC, or -1 for the most recently saved state.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RoundRect
element.short: Draws a filled rectangle with rounded corners.
element.descr: The rectangle is outlined with the current Pen, and filled with the current Brush.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RoundRect.RX
element.short: The extent of the ellipse, used for the rounded corners.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RoundRect.RY
element.short: The extent of the ellipse, used for the rounded corners.

element.name: TWidgetSet.SaveDC
element.short: Saves the state of an Device Context in the context stack.

element.name: TWidgetSet.SaveDC.Result
element.short: The index of the saved DC, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ScreenToClient
element.short: Converts absolute Screen coordinates into Client relative coordinates.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ScreenToClient.Handle
element.short: The handle of the window with the client area.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ScrollWindowEx
element.short: Scrolls the content of a window, by a number of pixels.

descr.p: The following flags are defined:

ul.li: SW_ERASE - when used with SW_INVALIDATE sends WM_ERASEBKGND messages for the invalidated parts of the window.
SW_INVALIDATE - invalidates the resulting hrgnUpdate region.
SW_SCROLLCHILDREN - also scrolls child windows within the scroll rect. Beware: also scrolls parts of the child windows!
SW_SMOOTHSCROLL - set HIWORD of flags to the time for the scrolling operation.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ScrollWindowEx.prcScroll
element.short: The part of the window, that is to be scrolled. Nil means the entire client area.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ScrollWindowEx.prcClip
element.short: Pixels falling outside this rectangle are lost. Nil means the entire client area.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ScrollWindowEx.hrgnUpdate
element.short: The invalidated parts of the window are added to this region (can be zero).

element.name: TWidgetSet.ScrollWindowEx.prcUpdate
element.short: Receives the boundary of the invalidated part of the window (can be Nil).

element.name: TWidgetSet.SendMessage
element.short: Sends a message directed to a window to the message pool of the application

descr.remark: This section was copied from LCLIntf, and may not apply to all platforms.
descr.p: This method is a thread-safe solution to send messages to windows.[?]

Those messages will be handled in the message loop of the application and therefore can be sent from any thread. They are not immediate, but they will awake the main thread if it is waiting for messages.
These messages can be handled by procedures with the keyword message in the class of a form for example. One would then use the handle of this form as the HandleWnd parameter of this routine.
Custom messages should always have an identification number (represented by the parameter Msg) larger then the constant LM_USER.
The two parameters WParam and LParam will be passed along to the window together with the Msg identification number.

The difference between SendMessage and PostMessage is the way that they return control to the calling thread. With SendMessage control is not returned until the window that the message was sent to has completed processing the sent message, however with PostMessage control is returned immediately.
